topic.title: inlist()
topic.para: Description: Matches the value of the specified field to a list stored in a file, allowing you to do simple, file-based black- and whitelisting. The file must be a plain-text file, containing one entry per line. The &abbrev; application loads the entire file, and compares the value of the specified field (for example, ${PROGRAM}) to entries in the file. When you use the in-list filter, note the following points:

listitem.para: Only exact matches are supported, partial and substring matches are not.
If you modify the list file, reload the configuration of &abbrev; for the changes to take effect.
